item.title: The Filesystem Hierarchy Standard
item.description: What is a Filesytem Current Linux Structure Directory Some advices What is a Filesystem A filesystem is the structure of how data is organized in Linux such as boot files, binaries, user´s data, config files, libraries, temp files, etc. A partition with a filesystem is needed in order to store these kind of files. On Linux there may be more than one partitions on disks using different filesystems. Those filesystems can be found mounted as subdirectories in the directory tree and even can be located either locally or across the network.
